properties.description: This is where Rawlings ships all of the baseballs to be distributed throughout the US
properties.title: Final destination

properties.description: This is where all of the raw materials come together and are made into the final product.
properties.title: Rawlings Factory

properties.description: This is where the leather is tanned. The leather makes up the outer composition of the baseball; the two white pieces of leather stitched together with red yarn. Without this company, the baseballs would not look the way they do today. The company, Tennessee Tanning, has been making leather for major league baseballs for over 60 years.
properties.title: Cowhide

properties.description: This is where the Yarn is made. Three layers of yarn is wrapped around the core. The yarn is made out of wool because wool has the ability to return to its original shape after being hit very hard with a bat. This company is called: D&T Spinning.
properties.title: Yarn

properties.description: This is where the rubber core is chemically manufactured. The core is the center of the baseball and is essential to its composition. The company that makes the core is called: Muscle Shoals Rubber Company.
properties.title: Rubber Cores
Manufacturing of the Cowhide to Rawlings Factory
Manufacturing of the Rubber Core to Rawlings Factory
Manufacturing of the Yarn to Rawlings Factory
Rawlings Factory to Final destination of all the Baseballs
Rawlings Baseballs
properties.description: This is the commodity chain of Rawlings Baseballs. These are the baseballs that the MLB uses on an everyday basis
